sense.name: regular compensation in exchange for labor
sense.examples: The foreman pays the construction workers their wages on Friday afternoon. The government ordered a wage freeze for three months. Mary listed her wages, tips and interest earned on her tax return. The pilots union received a wage concession of 5 percent from the airline. The students marched in support of a living wage for the custodial staff at their university.

sense.name: the share of the total GNP that is earned income
sense.examples: Wages and unearned income both increased this quarter according to economists. Reports for wages and orders for durable goods will come out next week.

sense.name: the reward or consequence for something
sense.commentary: WAGE[+state][+consequence][+reward] Note: a metaphoric extension of sense 1
sense.examples: The wages of sin is death.
